text: Eliyahu Bakshi-Doron (; April 5, 1941 â€“ April 12, 2020) was an Israeli rabbi. He was Rishon LeZion (Chief Rabbi of Israel) from 1993 to 2003. He was Sephardi Chief Rabbi of Bat Yam from 1972 and Sephardi Chief Rabbi of Haifa from 1972 to 1990. He was born in Jerusalem. Bakshi-Doron died on April 12, 2020 of COVID-19 in Jerusalem. ==References== Category:1941 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Chief Rabbis of Israel Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Jerusalem Category:Rabbis from Jerusalem
title: Eliyahu Bakshi-Doron
